overview_of_class:
The creative enterprises are in the midst of a revolution. Technological innovation and globalization have
spawned new ways of creating and distributing content. Making sense of the ongoing transformation of the
creative enterprises and the corresponding business models are the focus of this course.

This class introduces business models in creative enterprises and builds upon other courses that students
have taken in the program. Students will analyze case studies of creative enterprises to determine viable
strategies and opportunities. The class also examines the role content plays in strategy implementation.
Students are taught frameworks for understanding and evaluating content and media platforms.

The modern creative enterprises environment will be highlighted via Yellowdig, and students will hear
firsthand from executives, who will describe their business strategies. Additionally, each student will craft a
detailed business analysis of the creative enterprise of their choice and work collaboratively with a group of
students on a case study presentation to bring together the key lessons from the course.
name: Business Models in Creative Enterprises
subject: MSLCE
